str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To interrupt, hinder. From en and kopto; to cut into, i.e. impede, detain.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Or neuter pleion, or pleon comparative of polus; more in quantity, number, or quality; also the major portion.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 2nd Person Singular
str2: Yours, thy, thine. From su; thine.
Considerateness, forbearance, fairness, gentleness, mildness. From epieikes; suitableness, i.e. equity, mildness.
To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Concisely, briefly. Adverb from a derivative of suntemno; concisely.
